Title: The Greatest Days of All
Lyrics:
A dirt dabber built its nest
On my only Sunday dress
And the roof leaked in my shoes
And when they dried they were too small
And the rats chewed a great big hole
In my only winter coat
And at night I'd hear them gnaw
The paper off my bedroom wall

But I still say those were the greatest days of all
Some happy and some sad
Some good and some bad
But I still say those were the greatest days of all

I used to wait by the garden gate
Where the hummingbirds came every day
To kiss the yellow roses
Growing up the garden wall
And in the tall grass I would lie
'Til evening shadows brought the night
Threw the window of my room
I'd hear the whippoorwill's sad call

And I still say those were the greatest days of all
Some happy and some sad
Some good and some bad
But I still say those were the greatest days of all

Title: Smokey Mountain Memories
Lyrics:
You ought to go north somebody told us
'Cause the air is filled with gold dust
And fortune falls like snow flakes in your hands
Now I don't recall who said it
But we'd spent our lives on credit
And so we headed out to find our promised land
Just poor Smokey Mountains farm folk
With nothing more than high hopes
So we hitched our station wagon to a star
But our dreams all fell in on us
'Cause there was no land of promise
Lord it's a struggle just keepin' sight of who you are
Oh, and these northern nights are dreary
My old southern heart is weary
As I wonder how the old folks are back home
But I know that they all love me
And I know they're thinking of me
And Smokey Mountains memories keep me strong
You know I've been thinkin' just a whole lot lately
About what's been and what awaits me
It takes all I've got to give what life demands
Lord, you go insane if you give in to it
Life's a mill and I've been through it
I'm just thankful I'm creative with my hands
Oh, and these northern nights they're dreary
These old southern eyes are teary
As I wonder how the old folks are back home
But I'll keep leanin' on my Jesus
I know He'll love and guide and lead us
And Smokey Mountains memories keep me strong
If I'll keep looking to the Father
He'll keep my heads above the water
While the Smokey Mountains memories keep me strong
My home sweet home

Title: A Cowboy's Ways
Lyrics:
Sometimes he gets crazy, as men are known to do
He'd lose his head in spite of everything he stands to lose
What is it in a man that makes him act like such a fool?

Even love can't change the things he ought to change the most
And it's pride that keeps him standing when he should be on his knees
Making apologies, but she loves him desperately

Oh but now and again, she wished he'd been a poet
So he'd know all the perfect lines to say
And have some great romantic way to show it
Be the hero riding up to save the day
And go riding high like a knight in shining armor
To sweep her up and carry her away
Oh but he don't have no magic ways to charm her
No, because even love can't change a cowboy's ways

"I love you" and "I'm sorry" are words that just don't come
Because words like that are no match for the kind that rule his tongue
But his eyes keep telling her "you know I love you anyway
No matter what I say, or what I never say"

Oh but now and again she wished he'd been a poet
So he'd know all the perfect lines to say
And have some great romantic way to show it
Be the hero riding up to save the day
And go riding high like a knight in shining armor
To sweep her up and carry her away
Oh but he don't have no magic ways to charm her
No, because even love can't change a cowboy's ways

And he was satisfied just being daddy to us children
And the man my mama lived her whole life for

Title: Glass Spider, 2018
Lyrics:
[Intro]
Up until one century ago there lived
In the Zi Duang province of an eastern country
A glass-like spider
Having devoured its prey
It would drape the skeletons over its web
In weeks creating a macabre shrine of remains
Its web was also unique, in that it had many layers
Like floors in a building
At the top of this palace-like place
Assembled with almost apparent care
Were tiny, shining objects
Glass, beads, dewdrops
One could almost call it an altar
When the breeze blew through this construction
It produced sounds of wailing, crying
Tiny wails, tiny cries
The baby spiders would get scared
And search frantically for their mother
But the glass spider would have long gone
Having known that the babies
Would survive somehow on their own
Oh, the glass spider had blue eyes almost like a human's
They shed tears at the wintered turn of the centuries

[Verse 1]
Don't you hear this wasted cry, life is over you
(Mommy come back 'cause the water's all gone)
But you've seen who's in Heaven, is there anyone in Hell?
(Gone, gone, the waters all gone)
(Mommy come back 'cause it's dark now)
(Oh-hoho-oh)
(Oh-hoho-oh)

Your insubordinance won't be tolerated or dismissed
Lord Salad, salad-head, Caesar Saladin
Real balancing shows true skill, baffling
That you think the current format readies warpath
Guardians to storm back, enemies - ignore that

[Verse 2: Saladin]
You're the one who's misled, you inbred
War is never fair, you misstep and get dead
I focus on real life, tactics, it's drastic
Like real war, your antics are tactless and spastic
Fanatic, your semantics are dramatic and climatic
But will it help when you get slammed in a panic? No!
I'm the real world, this is your awakening
No disabling because death is unwavering
Fellwinters Peak's where I'm stationing
Gain nothing from staying in the tower, can’t stand to watch you capering
Remember twilight gap, take your role serious

Now you throw away any talent you had stowed away

Now you can't even set the placings at the table of Great Kings

Title: The Joker Vs Batman
Lyrics:
[Verse 1: Joker]
Listen here, little Bat, I’m feeling mischievous
Predicting sinistorus acts to bury insignificance
What is life? You just work and get certificates
I took another path, one with varying predicaments
Have some adventure, living by a code
Is played out, how about you start with breaking bones?
When you see a villain, don’t you want to break their nose
So go ahead and do it, justice served with throwing bows
We’re all a little crazy, I’m just more direct
I don’t have the time to wait, I don’t think I don’t regret
All I do is do, what I do, you don’t expect
So you call it anarchy, I’m leaving this city wrecked

[Chorus: Joker]
B A T M A N G
Don’t you understand, Bat? You complete me
Give into the dark side, let it be free
We're aren’t really different at all, and you’ll see
When the chips are down, people they are fake
And I’ll be there, Bats, to tell you of your mistakes
I’ll be there, Bats, the minute you lose faith
And I’ll be there, laughing the second your soul breaks

[Verse 2: Batman & Joker]
Listen here, Joker, I just want to end this
I’m tired of the back and forth, the fightings proving endless
I can keep putting you away, but it's sensless
We’re just gonna end up killing each other, the edge is
Right here, we are both products of our tragedy
We just took it differently with you amassing apathy
I took every bit of rage and bottled any agony
To use against the people that were causing others casualties
Aren’t you tired of this game of cat and mouse?
When it ends, everyone in your posse is flattened out
It’s a broken record, I’m telling you just quit
I can rehabilitate you, instead of a thrust kick
It’s your last chance, so think on it real hard
You done real harm, families broken, you’ve killed, marred
I’m giving you an option, I don’t want to hurt you
"It’s too late, Bats, there’s nothing else that you can do"
